reviews.text: My nine-year-old loved the water slide and pool. I liked the hot tub and the fireplace in our room. The breakfast had a lot of variety, was fresh and impressive. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: visit

reviews.text: Excellent breakfast. Friendly staff especially Ashley. Sofa in room 214 needs replacing immediately as it is a disgrace to super 8. Bathroom vent filthy . could not turn it on as the dirt was flying out of it. Tv's need to be upgraded to flat screen. I will not stay or recommend this hotel to anyone until I know the know the sofa has been replaced as the manager is aware of it. I want to be advised of the outcome .
reviews.title: Excellent breakfast. Friendly staff especially Ashley. Sofa...

reviews.text: Our stay was very friendly and good for the price, we always stay here (3 yrs in a row) at xmas time to visit family. The pool was clean good and pleasant. Morning Breaky is always good with the waffle maker, also a good variety of other items. We had a large room with a fireplace but this had no desk for computers and blank walls. The showers could use more pressure also but the rooms are clean and tidy. We enjoyed our stay and will return
reviews.title: resonable
Lovely staff!
reviews.text: We stayed here recently on our way to Spokane. It had been recommended because of the spa and pool. We were lucky to get the last room! The staff at checking-Peggy, was very helpful and went out of her way to make us feel welcome. We arrived in the middle of a spring storm and had just driven from Jasper through snow and rain so were glad of a king size bed and the chance to relax in the spa. Our room was clean, although the furniture was dated and the couch in need of some repair. The linen and towels were clean and fresh. We enjoyed our stay here.
The stay was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were fine, beds comfortable and clean. The hotel is starting to show its age, but is well looked after
reviews.title: The stay was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. The...

reviews.text: We stayed here while passing through Cranbrook on our way back to Alberta. We picked it because it was the least expensive place in Cranbrook since we were only going to be there for 10 hours. Rooms were clean, customer service was good. There was free wifi and free breakfast - which had some hot items and a waffle maker. Helped us get up and on the road quickly. The hotel is at the north edge of town which can either be a good thing or a bad thing. Made it easy to get out of there quickly if heading north but that is only if you have already filled up with gas and don't need to make any stops since there is really nothing past the hotel. We would definitely stay here again if passing though Cranbrook again.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a one night stay

reviews.text: Due to busy time, my room was not clean and ready when I came to check in. The front desk person confirmed it was only my daughter and I staying and offered us a King Room instead of our double Queen Room. Problem solved quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: accomodating staff
Clean and friendly
reviews.text: If you have a dog this is the place. It was very clean and reasonably priced. Staff was friendly. The pool an hot tub were easily accessed and they had a good breakfast, freshly made waffles, cereal ,yogurt and fresh fruit.

Our room had not been vacuumed for god knows how long. The bathroom housed numerous long black hairs and I have blond hair. The stairs to the second floor were super dirty. We come on a yearly vacation. Last time we stay at this SUper 8. This hotel should go for $59 a night. On the flipside, the lady at the front desk was amazing. She was so helpful and cheerful. Thank you for trying to hold it together for a company that is under staffing the hotel. You deserve a raise!
reviews.title: Dirty.

reviews.text: We stayed with a hockey group. My first room was located beind the laundry room - 104- it was so humid and smelt of animals. The employee was great! when I said I needed a change in rooms. I moved up to 226. It was a clean room. Very dated. The whole place was very clean. The pool was great! and the breakfast was good as well. Tea and Coffee were available all day and night. The price was great at $80.00 a night!
reviews.title: A mixed bag...but reasonable
